children.subject: Since you took a good chunk of 61A already and had other coding experiences, it seems like you won't have to leap over the hurdle of getting used to programming that other students new to CS would have when they take 61A. From that I'd say you're fine to take it over the summer, and given your plan to declare it may be the sensible thing to do. I haven't taken 61A over the summer, but I took 70 over the summer which I needed to declare. I would just say if you are taking another class with it make sure that 61A is your priority if you need to get a good grade, but it seems like you'll do just fine.
I think taking 61A this summer is a great idea! You should totally do it!

history.content:
Hi everyone! I'm an incoming sophomore trying to decide if I should take CS 61A remotely over the summer. (The plan would then be to take 61B in fall and 70 in spring.) My reasoning was that I should try to spread out major prerequisites and ensure that I can promptly declare, but 61A would not be my only commitment that summer (my internship got canceled but I would be taking another summer class). Does anyone who has taken it over the summer have any advice for me? 

Some things about me that might be relevant—my only coding experience is Data 8 and a high school computer science course, and I was in 61A for the first four weeks of one semester before deciding I needed to take it later (so, I've done Hog but I'm also aware the class only gets more challenging). Thank you in advance and I apologize if this isn't the right place to post!

Also, as a side question, if 61B and 61A won't expand until Phase 2, should I phase 1?
history.subject: CS 61A Summer
